attributes.action: Stop Prime Ministers who have a short service in office unproportioned benefits.
attributes.additional_details: Review this prime minister package and limit it to those who have served sufficient time scale such as at least a year (unless having stepped down for health reasons).
attributes.background: The reasoning is that Liz Truss as prime minister has taken this country to its economic knees in less than six weeks of office. Dose this deserve £115,000.00 annual golden handshake?

rejection.details:
The Public Duty Costs Allowance is claimable for reimbursement of incurred expenses for necessary office costs and secretarial costs arising from their special position in public life. You can find out more about this allowance here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/public-duty-cost-allowance/public-duty-costs-allowance-guidance

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Restrict Public Duties Cost allowance to Prime Ministers who won an election: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625646

Introduce a three month "qualifying period" for Prime Minister PDCA eligibility: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625990
